p: The application of Streptomyces sp. strain DBT34 on chickpea plants and subsequent production of a methanolic extract from the treated and untreated plants resulted in IC 50 values of 117.5 µg/mL (DPPH) and 114.0 µg/mL (ABTS) and IC 50 values of 266.2 µg/mL (DPPH) and 169.3 µg/mL (ABTS) in untreated plants ( Figure 10 and Figure S1). The lower IC 50 values obtained for the methanolic extracts (µg/mL) of treated plants, relative to untreated plants, indicates that free radical scavenging in the treated plants was enhanced due to the presence of Streptomyces sp. strain DBT34 as an endophytic in the treated chickpea plants.
